result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aportier Maurice Weeks Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
File was returned to court for entry of disposition from 8-11-2015.
Assigned clerk of Branch 38 contacted court reporter and DA's office for disposition of this matter.
On 8-11-2015: State appeared by ADA Benjamin Verhulst.  Atty Kevin Dunn appeared with the defendant in court and in custody.
The state made a global resolution for all three cases, 14CM3716, 15CM798 and 15CM1418.  Upon plea/sentencing in 15CM798, the state moved to dismiss the other 2 cases.
This case was ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing in 15CM798.

Attorney Kevin B. Dunn in court, defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Offer of the State will remain open until 7-2-2015, per ADA Odom.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-5-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Attorney Kevin B. Dunn in court, defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Offer and discovery received by defense counsel for the (3) three cases.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense counsel, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2014CM3716, 2015CM798 and 2015CM1418.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-18-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Attorney Kevin B. Dunn in court (via telephonics), defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings (dental procedure), therefore, Pretrial Conference rescheduled to Branch 4 on 5-19-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Kevin B. Dunn in court, defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail / Bond hearing not requested by defense counsel.  Upon the request of defense counsel, who will need an offer from the State, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-13-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Kevin B. Dunn in court, defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks not in court, in custody.   Case in Br. 23 for Br. 4.  Attorney Dunn does not want to conduct a bail motion today.  Matter  transferred back to Br. 4 for a Bail Motion.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jessica P

Defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Aportier Maurice Weeks in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/Bond Hearing to be heard by Judge Grady for Judge Flanagan.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 308 West Mitchell Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
